GAME

Class CanvasListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • GAME.CanvasListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.MouseInputListener

    public class CanvasListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.swing.event.MouseInputListener
    CanvasListener is the one responsible for listening mouse/keyboard inputs and for the one who will do the corresponding actions.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CanvasListener

        public CanvasListener(Solitaire game,
                      Location stock,
                      Location talon,
                      Location[] foundation,
                      Location[] tableau,
                      Location[] formerTab,
                      java.awt.image.BufferedImage back,
                      int[] toggleArray,
                      EnvironmentBuilder environment)
        This constructor is needed for instantiating this class into an object, sets some attribute with the passed parameter, and creates the necessary objects.
        Parameters:
        game - of type Solitaire holds the data and the current state of the game.
        stock - of type Location holds the current location of the stock pile in gui.
        talon - of type Location holds the current location of the cards in the talon pile in gui.
        foundation - of type Location[] holds the current location of the foundation piles in gui.
        tableau - of type Location[] holds the current location of the open cards in the tableau piles.
        formerTab - of type Location[] holds the location of the movablee/moving card/cards in the tableau piles.
        back - of type BufferedImage holds the object with the image of the back of card.
        toggleArray - of type int[] holds the current condition of the cards, which will tell what's on top and is moving.
        environment - of EnvironmentBuilder type holds the object where the environment is located.
